#Text=Use Modern Psychology to Live a Happy Life
#Text=The field of Psychology had long been dominated by disorders .

#Text=Since the 1990s , however , a new breed of psychologists , led by Martin Seligman , Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi , and Jonathan Haidt , among others , launched the " positive psychology " movement , focusing their research and projects on human flourishing - how to develop our values , strengths , virtues , and talents , and find meaning , purpose , and fulfillment in our lives .

column1: #Text=Steps
#Text=Know yourself .
#Text=Quiz thyself at the University of Pennsylvania 's free Questionnaires Center .
#Text=Try the General Happiness Scale , Satisfaction with Life Scale , Optimism Test , and Character Strengths ( long form ) ;
#Text=Listen to your critics - a good place to look for wisdom is where you least expect it : in the minds of your opponents ;
#Text=If you 've been feeling down for weeks , take the CES-D ( depression ) Questionnaire .
#Text=If you score below 16 , seek help from a mental health professional , and let your doctor know .
#Text=Strengthen your body and your mind .
#Text=Body - walking even just 15 mins/day , 5 days a week , makes a big difference ( bonus points if you walk with a friend ) ; take 2 fish-oil pills a day to help your mood , brain , and heart ;

#Text=Mind - meditate even just 15 mins/day - there are tons of free resources for an easy , guided , start ; try Cognitive Behavior Therapy ; hypnosis ( no , really ) ; happy pills - selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors ( SSRI ) - ask your doctor .
#Text=Work on your relationships harder than you do your work .
#Text=On your deathbed , will you wish you had spent more time at the office , or with your friends and family ?
#Text=Work on your most valued relationships .
#Text=Do something thoughtful and out of the ordinary .
#Text=Write gratitude letters .
#Text=Learn the science of love & attachment , together ;
#Text=Join a gang , or start one .
#Text=Get together weekly or monthly to share an activity ;
#Text=Perform random acts of kindness ;
#Text=Get a dog - they co-evolved with us , and their ability to bond and to love meshes well with our own
#Text=Like what you do .
#Text=Focus on how you help people and contribute to the common good ;
#Text=Focus on your strengths ( see Step 1 ) and use at least one of them every day , in a new way ;
#Text=Master your work ;
#Text=Find Flow - do challenging tasks that use your strengths ; concentrate ; get immediate feedback as you progress ;
#Text=Take control , even a little control , over how your work is done ;
#Text=Build alliances - connect and engage with people who can make your work better
#Text=Reach outside of yourself .
#Text=Be a bee - our lives only make full sense as members of a larger hive , or as cells in a larger body .
#Text=Try religion , teaching , science , political campaigns ;
#Text=Join an organization that has a noble purpose and a noble past .
#Text=Any volunteer work can take you beyond yourself , but one that has history , traditions , and rituals makes it easier ;
#Text=Try to live a virtuous life - enhance peace , harmony & cooperation ; exercise your best virtues ( see Step 1 ) ;

#Text=Be One with The Multiverse - in a unified whole , where everything is accepted , nothing is judged ; lose your self in an infinity of wonder , awe , joy , love , and gratitude ( f. e via an ecstatic religious experience , or psilocybin mushrooms - ask your shaman ) .
